New Records: Freddie Freeman hit a home run in his fifth straight World Series game, going back to the Braves' 2021 title run.
Key Match Events: Freddie Freeman hit a two-run home run in the first inning.
Walker Buehler pitched five scoreless innings.
Alex Verdugo hit a two-run homer with two outs in the ninth inning.
Gavin Lux stole second base and scored on a single by Kiké Hernández.
Giancarlo Stanton was thrown out at home plate in the fourth inning.
Pre-Game Insights: Shohei Ohtani was in the lineup despite a shoulder injury, leading off and DHing.
Max Muncy mentioned the importance of having Ohtani in the lineup despite his injury.
Ohtani informed teammates he would be available for the game despite his injury.
Post-Match Reflections: Aaron Boone calmly reacted to a missed call strikeout, showing the Yankees' drained energy.
Max Muncy reflected on the team's focus despite Ohtani's injury.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Yankees' home crowd showed strong support, with a standing ovation for Aaron Judge.
Derek Jeter threw out the first pitch to fire up the local crowd.
